result.execSummary:
Anthony Antwan Poole was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Anthony Antwan Poole was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Antwan Poole

records.addlTxt: Clerk was notified by Sheriff's Dept that defendant was released to Linn Co Iowa on 7/18-case closed.
Clerk review scheduled to determine if defendant was extradited per this case.
Further proceedings on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases 22CF188 & 22CF190 called together - 10:21 AM Defendant Anthony Antwan Poole appeared by video, in custody. Atty. Benjamin Lindsay appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant waives preliminary hearing on 22CF188. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea on 21CF188.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:37 PM Anthony Poole in person in custody and by Atty. Heather Dvoran. Atty. Antonella Aleman Zientak appears for the State of Wisconsin. Corporal Dan Gahan sworn and testified. Exam by Court. Defendant is not contesting extradition. Court signs paperwork.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
